title: Code audit: refactor for Nuxt 4/Vue 3.5 best practices
description:
Comprehensive code review and refactoring to leverage modern patterns and libraries.

This task should be split into multiple parallel subagents, each focusing on a different area:

**Agent 1: Nuxt 4 & Data Loading Patterns**
- Review composables for Nuxt 4 best practices
- Check useFetch/useAsyncData usage patterns
- Evaluate server route implementations (h3, Nitro)
- Look for opportunities to use Nuxt modules (e.g., @nuxt/fonts, @nuxtjs/seo)
- Review caching strategies and storage layer
- Check auto-imports and type safety

**Agent 2: Vue 3.5 & Reactivity Patterns**
- Review for Vue 3.5 features (reactive props destructuring, useTemplateRef, etc.)
- Check component composition and props/emits patterns
- Look for unnecessary reactivity overhead
- Review lifecycle hooks and async component patterns
- Check for proper TypeScript typing with defineProps/defineEmits

**Agent 3: VueUse Integration**
- Find opportunities to replace custom logic with VueUse composables
- Review state management (useLocalStorage, useSessionStorage)
- Check event handling (useEventListener, useClickOutside)
- Look for timing/animation patterns (useIntervalFn, useRafFn)
- Review media/audio patterns that VueUse might simplify

**Agent 4: Performance & Bundle Optimization**
- Review component lazy loading opportunities
- Check for unnecessary watchers or computed properties
- Look for render performance issues
- Evaluate bundle size and code splitting
- Review image loading patterns (@nuxt/image optimization)
- Check for memory leaks in audio player or long-lived components

**Agent 5: Library & Module Opportunities**
- Research Nuxt modules for RSS/feed handling
- Look for better audio player libraries or Nuxt integrations
- Evaluate UI component library options (Nuxt UI, Radix Vue)
- Check for podcasting-specific libraries
- Look for SEO/metadata management improvements

Each agent should provide:
1. Current pattern found in codebase with file:line references
2. Recommended improvement with code example
3. Justification (performance, maintainability, best practice)
4. Priority (high/medium/low)

Create follow-up tasks for specific refactorings as needed.
close_reason: Code audit complete: all refactoring issues identified and tracked as separate tasks. Major items addressed: tsconfig extended to .nuxt/tsconfig.json, duplicate utilities consolidated, unnecessary imports removed, wasteful plugin pattern fixed.

title: Audit @nuxt/image configuration and evaluate image provider setup
description: @nuxt/image is registered in nuxt.config.ts:17 but has zero configuration — no image block, no provider, no domains, no format settings. title: Fix audio player hydration mismatches on first load
description:
The AudioPlayer component causes Vue hydration mismatches on every page load. SSR renders an empty/default player state, but the client plugin (audio-player.client.ts) calls preload() after mount, setting currentEpisode — creating a mismatch between server-rendered HTML and client state.

Affected elements: audio-player img, h3.audio-player__title, button.audio-player__play-btn, span (time display).

Fix options:
1. Wrap the AudioPlayer in <ClientOnly> so it only renders on the client, preventing the mismatch entirely
2. Initialize player state during SSR so it matches client state (harder since we don't know which episode to preload without fetching the feed server-side in the layout)
3. Use useHydration() or suppressHydrationWarning on the affected elements

Option 1 (ClientOnly) is simplest and appropriate since the audio player is purely client-side functionality.

title: Fix [slug].vue accessing podcast2 fields at wrong level (transcript, funding, persons)
description:
In app/pages/episodes/[slug].vue:266, the template checks episode.transcript, episode.funding, and episode.persons directly. But per types/podcast.ts:93, these fields are nested under episode.podcast2 (e.g., episode.podcast2.transcript, episode.podcast2.funding, episode.podcast2.persons).

The template accesses them at the wrong level, so Podcasting 2.0 features will never render even when present in the feed data.
close_reason: Already correctly implemented: episode.podcast2?.transcript/funding/persons accessed at correct level

title: Fix SpeedMenu dark mode using prefers-color-scheme instead of data-theme attribute
description:
